message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.DS 

This paper discusses the use of blockchain technology and smart contracts for implementing a large-scale event-based Internet of Things (IoT) control system. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), as the paper focuses on security and access control mechanisms. The paper also discusses the characteristics and limitations of IoT devices and applications, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper discusses the distributed nature of the ledger and the parallel execution of smart contracts, which could fall under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also discusses the design of a blockchain-based IoT architecture, which could fall under cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper discusses the use of custom tokens for access control, which could fall under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
